intro: Oxydectes refracta, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves and produces small, white or yellow flowers in early spring. The plant is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained environments. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, and is commonly cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value. Oxydectes refracta is also valued for its ability to stabilize soil and prevent erosion in marginal habitats.
